jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #4779: ARROW-4223: [Python] Support scipy.sparse integration
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4779#discussion_r300443018
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/tests/test_serialization.py
 ##########
 @@ -510,6 +511,30 @@ def deserializer(data):
     assert np.alltrue(new_x.view(np.ndarray) == np.zeros(3))
 
 
+def test_scipy_sparse_tensor_coo_serialization(tmpdir):
+    path = os.path.join(str(tmpdir), 'pyarrow_scipy_sparse_tensor_serialization_test.bin')
+
+    data = np.array([1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1])
+    row  = np.array([0, 0, 1, 3, 1, 0, 0])
+    col  = np.array([0, 2, 1, 3, 1, 0, 0])
+    shape = (4, 4)
+
+    sparse_array = coo_matrix((data, (row, col)), shape=shape)
+    serialized = pa.serialize(sparse_array)
 
 Review comment:
   Can you test deserialization as well?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #4779: ARROW-4223: [Python] Support scipy.sparse integration
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4779#discussion_r300443434
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/serialization.py
 ##########
 @@ -76,6 +77,35 @@ def _deserialize_numpy_matrix(data):
         return np.matrix(data[0], dtype=np.dtype(data[1]), copy=False)
 
 
+# ----------------------------------------------------------------------
+# Set up serialization for scipy sparse matrices. Primitive types are handled
+# efficiently with Arrow's SparseTensor facilities, see numpy_convert.cc)
+
+def _serialize_scipy_sparse(obj):
+    if isspmatrix_coo(obj):
+        coords = np.vstack([obj.row, obj.col]).T
+        return pyarrow.SparseTensorCOO.from_numpy(obj.data, coords, obj.shape)
 
 Review comment:
   do you need to return a tuple here with the sparse type? (at least that seems the way you expect the data in deserialize)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #4779: ARROW-4223: [Python] Support scipy.sparse integration
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4779#discussion_r300443439
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/serialization.py
 ##########
 @@ -76,6 +77,35 @@ def _deserialize_numpy_matrix(data):
         return np.matrix(data[0], dtype=np.dtype(data[1]), copy=False)
 
 
+# ----------------------------------------------------------------------
+# Set up serialization for scipy sparse matrices. Primitive types are handled
+# efficiently with Arrow's SparseTensor facilities, see numpy_convert.cc)
+
+def _serialize_scipy_sparse(obj):
+    if isspmatrix_coo(obj):
+        coords = np.vstack([obj.row, obj.col]).T
+        return pyarrow.SparseTensorCOO.from_numpy(obj.data, coords, obj.shape)
+
+    elif isspmatrix_csr(obj):
+        return pyarrow.SparseTensorCSR.from_numpy(obj.data, obj.indptr, obj.indices, obj.shape)
+
+    else:
+        obj_csr = obj.to_csr()
+        return pyarrow.SparseTensorCSR.from_numpy(obj_csr.data, obj_csr.indptr, obj_csr.indices, obj_csr.shape)
 
 Review comment:
   you have some long lines here (PEP8)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

rok commented on pull request #4779: ARROW-4223: [Python] Support scipy.sparse integration
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4779#discussion_r300449591
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/serialization.py
 ##########
 @@ -76,6 +77,35 @@ def _deserialize_numpy_matrix(data):
         return np.matrix(data[0], dtype=np.dtype(data[1]), copy=False)
 
 
+# ----------------------------------------------------------------------
+# Set up serialization for scipy sparse matrices. Primitive types are handled
+# efficiently with Arrow's SparseTensor facilities, see numpy_convert.cc)
+
+def _serialize_scipy_sparse(obj):
+    if isspmatrix_coo(obj):
+        coords = np.vstack([obj.row, obj.col]).T
+        return pyarrow.SparseTensorCOO.from_numpy(obj.data, coords, obj.shape)
 
 Review comment:
   Thanks for looking at this Joris!
   You mean why don't we do: `pyarrow.SparseTensorCOO.from_numpy(obj.data, obj.row, obj.col, obj.shape)`? See: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4446#pullrequestreview-256390267
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #4779: ARROW-4223: [Python] Support scipy.sparse integration
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4779#discussion_r300450975
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/serialization.py
 ##########
 @@ -76,6 +77,35 @@ def _deserialize_numpy_matrix(data):
         return np.matrix(data[0], dtype=np.dtype(data[1]), copy=False)
 
 
+# ----------------------------------------------------------------------
+# Set up serialization for scipy sparse matrices. Primitive types are handled
+# efficiently with Arrow's SparseTensor facilities, see numpy_convert.cc)
+
+def _serialize_scipy_sparse(obj):
+    if isspmatrix_coo(obj):
+        coords = np.vstack([obj.row, obj.col]).T
+        return pyarrow.SparseTensorCOO.from_numpy(obj.data, coords, obj.shape)
 
 Review comment:
   I meant the actual return value, not how the SparseTensor is created. Eg in the deserialize, you do ``data[0] == 'coo'``

 ##########
 @@ -76,6 +77,35 @@ def _deserialize_numpy_matrix(data):
         return np.matrix(data[0], dtype=np.dtype(data[1]), copy=False)
 
 
+# ----------------------------------------------------------------------
+# Set up serialization for scipy sparse matrices. Primitive types are handled
+# efficiently with Arrow's SparseTensor facilities, see numpy_convert.cc)
+
+def _serialize_scipy_sparse(obj):

+        coords = np.vstack([obj.row, obj.col]).T
+        return pyarrow.SparseTensorCOO.from_numpy(obj.data, coords, obj.shape)

   Oh, yeah, true! Thanks!
   The plan was I write the basic python test first and then do the serialization next and then get back to python again.

rok commented on issue #4779: ARROW-4223: [Python] Support scipy.sparse integration
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4779#issuecomment-516195905
 
 
   Hey @mrkn. I'm trying to enable components serialization for sparse tensor to enable cases like [this test](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/18e302f696d33109ebc8709665cf7086bad4d4ea/python/pyarrow/tests/test_serialization.py#L534). I'm using [GetSparseTensorMessage](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/18e302f696d33109ebc8709665cf7086bad4d4ea/cpp/src/arrow/ipc/writer.cc#L816), but I'm not sure if this is the right way to go. Could you please give some feedback on [GetSparseTensorMessage](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/18e302f696d33109ebc8709665cf7086bad4d4ea/cpp/src/arrow/ipc/writer.cc#L816)?
   I want to implement this to enable [Torch serialization](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/18e302f696d33109ebc8709665cf7086bad4d4ea/python/pyarrow/serialization.py#L225).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

fields.description: It would be great to support integration with scipy.sparse.

comments.body:
I would need something like this:
{code:python}
import pyarrow as pa
import numpy as np
from scipy import sparse

array = sparse.random(1000, 1000)

serialized = pa.serialize(array)

assert np.array_equal(array.toarray(), serialized.deserialize().toarray())
{code}

I'll open a PR to address it.
